intro: Dimorphanthes sicula, commonly known as the Sicilian dimorphanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Sicily. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
